content: Now that some of the prisoners at Gitmo have been held in secret prisons and tortured, they cannot be tried in U.S. Courts, with rights guaranteed by our Constitution. They must be tried by Military Commissions that are set up to provide due process of commonly recognized trial procedures, without publicizing classified material. It can be done by setting up the Commissions based on the Uniformed Code of Military Justice. Putting the enemy through the same legal system that we would put our own military through is a fair process. From the new York Times, May 2, 2009 “The Obama administration is moving toward reviving the military commission system for prosecuting Guantánamo detainees, which was a target of critics during the Bush administration, including Mr. Obama himself.” “In a news conference this week, Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. emphasized that if the administration did use military commissions, the rules must give detainees “a maximum amount of due process.”” “The military commissions, which were established specifically for trying Guantánamo detainees, have been subject to repeated delays and court challenges that argued that detainees were being denied basic rights of American law. Only two trials have been completed in the nearly eight years since the Bush administration announced that it would use military tribunals. “ “The Bush administration’s commission system was criticized in part because it permitted evidence that would often be barred in federal court, like evidence obtained through coercive interrogations and hearsay.” “The administration is likely to make it more difficult for prosecutors to admit hearsay, while not excluding it entirely, the lawyers said. The hearsay issue is central to many Guantánamo cases because they are based on intelligence reports and detainees may never be permitted to cross-examine the sources of those reports.”

content: Once again President Obama is showing that he is not afraid to make the hard decisions. The way to tell it is a good decision – he is being attacked by the far left and the far right. The left says he is being like President Bush by using the Military Tribunals – ignoring that the Administration lawyers are working to make the Tribunals acceptable to the international legal community. The right will attack him for flip-flopping because someone once told them that anytime a politician changes his mind about a policy it is a bad thing. However, Senator Obama voted for the Military Tribunals in 2006. The only reason that they have not worked is because the rules that the Bush Administration came up with after that vote made the tribunals a kangaroo court where even the military judges and prosecutors would not participate in them. It is the best interest of the country for these few prisoners to be judged by Military Tribunals. President Obama is willing to take the heat for the good of the country.
